brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare the measure of the CO2 obtained on the end-tidal
      expiratory gas (ETCO2) with the value of CO2 obtained by transcutaneous measure (PTCO2), in
      home-ventilated neuromuscular patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Concordance Between ETCO2, PTCO2 and PaCO2 in the Home-ventilated Neuromuscular Patient

detailed_description.textblock:
Monitoring of the effectiveness of ventilation in patients with neuromuscular require to
      regularly measure blood gases and in particular carbon dioxide (CO2). The reference
      technique is arterial puncture. In recent years, a non-invasive techniques measuring CO2 by
      transcutaneous sensor (PTCO2) was introduced among the tools regularly used for follow-up
      monitoring of home ventilated patients.

      Another technique for monitoring CO2, originally developed for anesthesia, is based on the
      measurement of exhaled CO2 (ETCO2). This technique requires relatively simple equipment, and
      represents a potential alternative for monitoring home-ventilated patients.

      Recently, sensors for ETCO2 were coupled to devices for home ventilation. To the best of our
      knowledge, the role of ETCO2 in monitoring long-term ventilated patients has not been
      investigated to date.

      The purpose of the study is to analyze the correlation between the two non-invasive methods
      for measuring CO2: PTCO2 and ETCO2, in a group of home-ventilated patients with
      neuromuscular disease.

      The patients will be recruited during a routine follow-up hospitalization for their
      home-ventilation, and the ETCO2 will be measured during one night, in addition to the
      routinely measured PTCO2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient with neuromuscular disease, treated with home invasive or non-invasive
             ventilation

          -  Male or female age higher or equal to 18 years

          -  Negative pregnancy test for women of childbearing age or having an effective
             contraception

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute Respiratory Failure

          -  Long-term oxygen therapy

          -  Refusal to participate in the study

          -  Plan of legal protection

          -  Pregnant Women

          -  Failure to cooperate

          -  No affiliation to a social security scheme

study_pop.textblock:
The patients will be recruited among the neuromuscular patients treated at the University
        Hospital Raymond Pointcaré, Garches (France), during a routine follow-up hospitalization
        for their home-ventilation.

intervention.description: Concomitant monitoring of ETCO2 and PTCO2
other_name: ETCO2: Module of the BREAS Vivo 50 home ventilator

clinical_study.official_title: Validation of the Measure of ETCO2, Compared to PTCO2 and PaCO2 in the Home-ventilated Neuromuscular Patient

other_outcome.description: evaluate the influence of circuit leakage on the gradient between PaCO2 and ETCO2
other_outcome.measure: influence of circuit leakage on the gradient between PaCO2 and ETCO2

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: concordance between the nocturnal average values of the CO2 measured by the two non-invasive techniques ETCO2 and PTCO2
primary_outcome.measure: concordance between the nocturnal average values of ETCO2 and PTCO2

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: concordance between the nocturnal maximal values of the CO2 measured by the two non-invasive techniques ETCO2 and PTCO2
secondary_outcome.measure: concordance between the nocturnal maximal values of ETCO2 and PTCO2

secondary_outcome.description: concordance between the variation of the values of the CO2 measured by the two non-invasive techniques ETCO2 and PTCO2
secondary_outcome.measure: concordance between the variation of the values of ETCO2 and PTCO2

secondary_outcome.description: concordance between the values of ETCO2, PTCO2 and arterial CO2 (PaCO2) measured at the same time
secondary_outcome.measure: concordance between the values of ETCO2, PTCO2 and arterial CO2 (PaCO2) measured at the same time
